intro: Spigelia cipoensis, commonly known as the Cipo Spigelia, is a flowering plant native to the rainforests of South America. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family, which includes many plants with milky sap and showy flowers. The plant produces clusters of red, tubular flowers that are adapted for pollination by birds and insects. Its leaves are typically oval and arranged oppositely along the stems. Spigelia cipoensis is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological role in its native habitat.
